author: Special Correspondent
text:
The city police have arrested a 20-year-old mechanical engineering student and a minor on charges of stealing mobile phones and electronic gadgets.

The suspects had targeted pedestrians on city roads, police said.

Police officials said the thefts came to light after they tracked down the international mobile station equipment identity number of one of the stolen mobile phones.

Investigations led policemen to Burma Bazaar, where a store owner gave them clues on the identity of the youth who had sold him the phone.

Police managed to trace the suspect Vijay (20), a final year mechanical engineering student, and his accomplice, a 17-year-old youth who is a school dropout, working in a hotel.

Modus operandi

While riding on their motorcycle, the duo targeted unsuspecting pedestrians and snatched mobile phones, police added.
title: Engineering student held for stealing mobile phones
